knimeNode.name: Kafka Producer Loop End
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node at the end of a loop that sends messages to a Kafka cluster.

fullDescription.intro: Node at the end of a loop. It is used to mark the end of a workflow loop and sends the intermediate results to a Kafka cluster.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: An id string to pass to the Kafka cluster when making requests. This string can be included as a logical application name in server-side request logging, thus making it easier to track the source of requests beyond ip/port.
A list of topics the producer sends the messages to. The topics list has to be entered in the form topic1,topic2,....
A String or JSON column containing the messages that have to be send to the Kafka cluster.

tab.name: Transaction Settings
tab.option: Specifies whether the messages have to be send in a transactional fashion or not.
The transaction id of the message producer. This id has to be unique.

Allows to specify the number of messages send per transaction.
Input end This option ensures that the whole input is send in a single transaction
Batchwise This option sends a fixed number of messages per transaction. Larger values result in less transactions but might stall message consumption.

tab.name: Advanced Settings
tab.option: Allows to specify additional producer related options, e.g., request timeout and number of retries. For further details on the individual options see the tooltip or consult the official Kafka documentation.

ports.inPort: (Intermediate) data table holding the column to be send to the Kafka cluster
Connection details used to create the Kafka Producer
